about.personal_text: Hi, my name is Jacob. I am from Poland, more specifically from the vicinity of the city of Gdańsk, where I also study computer science. I am a naturally friendly person who can talk about everything and nothing. I started my programming journey with web development, and currently, I write complex full-stack applications.
about.experience_text: I started my first job in the profession iun April 2022 as a full-stack developer. I learned many interesting things there, such as software containerization, a bit of Kubernetes, and above all, teamwork. I also got to know new frontend frameworks lie Vue.js, Angular, as well backend frameworks like Flask and FastAPI.
about.student_text: I am a graduate of the Computer Science program with a specialization in Artificial Intelligence at the Polish-Japanese Academy of Information Technology in Gdańsk.
about.hobby_text_music: My favorite music genders are pop and dance/electronic. For relaxation, I also enjoy listening to jazz
about.hobby_text_programming: I've been interested in programming for several years now, mainly because I can create something without the need for various physical materials, only relying on knowledge and skills. I especially love creating user-friendly interfaces with interesting animations.
about.hobby_text_ai: I don't have much experience with artificial intelligence in terms of coding. I acquired my current knowledge during my studies, where I learned artificial intelligence search patterns and scikit-learn algorithms.In my free time, I try to continue my course on artificial intelligence. What sparked my interest? I believe that artificial intelligence has the potential to accelerate certain processes or make them easier for us, such as information retrieval. And as we know, everyone likes it when it's easier.
about.hobby_text_cloud: I had contact with the cloud during the AWS course, and privately, I set up programs or servers on Oracle Cloud. I'm curious about how it looks from the perspective of source code and what the architecture planning looks like.
about.hobby_text_cooking: My interest in cooking arose by chance. When I was looking for a break from programming to relax a bit, I thought that maybe cooking could help me with that. I enjoy eating everything, but I particularly favor Asian and Italian cuisine.
about.hobby_text_draw: I like browsing, for example, Pinterest, in search of a new wallpaper or simply to view someone's creativity. I don't draw myself, I don't have trained skills or talents in that direction, but I enjoy imagining what's in the picture.

skills.cpp_text: In C++ / C, I am a beginner when it comes to projects, and I mostly play around with it rather than creating something larger. I had the opportunity to work on slightly larger projects in this language during my studies. The first one was related to metaheuristics, where everyone had to choose a problem and implement a genetic algorithm for it. My problem was the subset sum problem. The second project involved writing sockets for file exchange.
skills.python_text: I use Python most often. Mainly because it's a truly powerful language with vast capabilities. I've had experience with frameworks like Django, FastAPI, and Flask. I often use helpful tools like Pandas, which makes tasks like reading Excel or CSV files easier, for example.
skills.js_text: I'm familiar with JavaScript frameworks / libraries like React, Next.js, Vue.js, and the basics of Angular. I haven't mastered them to perfection, and I often need to refer to documentation or seek help online.
skills.docker: I mainly use Docker for containerizing databases. One drawback of Docker (the free version) is the limited capability to create images, which can make testing with Kubernetes more challenging for projects with a larger number of containers.
skills.database_text: I'm quite familiar with Cassandra, MongoDB, and SQL databases. I encounter SQL databases the most at work. Thanks to this, I've become acquainted with sql-alchemy as well as database connectors.
skills.linux: I spend most of my time on UNIX-based systems, primarily MacOS or Linux Mint. Privately, I try to work on Windows 11 with WSL. I have basic knowledge about system tools and configuring these systems
skills.git: I can work with the Git version control system. It is essential for team collaboration and facilitates tracking changes. I can initialize repositories, add and commit changes, work with branches, resolve conflicts, review commit histories, pull changes from other branches, and update the currently used one.

portfolio.chat_app_text: The app is modeled on one of the most popular chat application, Discord
portfolio.dc_bot_text: The voice assistant was created with the intention of making it easier to execute basic commands on Discord using voice.
portfolio.developing: The project is currently under development. After the release of the test version, a link will be provided.
